body:
### Symphony data acquisition for .Net

Symphony is a modern physiology data acquisition framework for Windows and .Net. 


### Getting Started

To get started, copy the DLLs in the externals\HDF5DotNet directory to the C:\Windows\System32. To build the installer, you will also need to install the [WiX](http://wixtoolset.org) installer toolset.

The solution (src\symphony-core\Symphony.sln) builds with Visual Studio 2010 and requires .Net 4.0.

### Using Symphony

For running experiments, you should install Symphony via the MSI. The Symphony framework is accessible from any .Net client. A Matlab-based front end has been developed at the Janelia Farm Research Campus of the Howard Hughes Medical Institute (see the [Symphony-UI](https://github.com/midgleyf/Symphony-UI) project).

### Authors and Contributors
Symphony was written by @barrywark and @tedneward at Physion Consulting (@physion).

### Support or Contact
Check out the documentation on the project Wiki, or add a ticket on the project issues page. Commercial support is available from Physion (info@physionconsulting.com for more info).

name: Symphony
